pullRequest.title: Map existing Tomcat properties to Spring Boot
pullRequest.bodyText:
Map the following properties used by tomcat

PXF_PORT
PXF_SHUTDOWN_PORT (NO LONGER NEEDED)
PXF_JVM_OPTS
PXF_MAX_THREADS
PXF_DEBUG
PXF_OOM_KILL

Also mapped properties from web.xml
From:
       <Connector acceptCount="100"
               connectionTimeout="20000"
               executor="tomcatThreadPool"
               maxKeepAliveRequests="15"
               maxHeaderCount="30000"
               maxHttpHeaderSize="1048576"
               port="${connector.http.port}"
               protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol"
               redirectPort="${connector.https.port}"/>

To:
# Settings migrated from web.xml
server.server-header=PXF Server
server.tomcat.accept-count=100
server.tomcat.connection-timeout=20000
server.max-http-header-size=1048576
pxf.tomcat.max-header-count=30000
pxf.tomcat.max-header-size=1048576

nodes.bodyText: In general, what is our new design ? Do we rely solely on application.properties and ask users to change values there or do we have an overrides property file that users should manage. I'd like to see all user-manageable properties go into an override file (similar to how we have default and override pxf-env.sh files now). Will .sh files still be there, if yes, why, if not, how will we migrate the values ?

commit.message:
Map existing Tomcat properties to Spring Boot #351

Map the following properties used by tomcat

- PXF_PORT
- PXF_SHUTDOWN_PORT (NO LONGER NEEDED)
- PXF_JVM_OPTS
- PXF_MAX_THREADS
- PXF_DEBUG
- PXF_OOM_KILL

Also mapped properties from web.xml

From:

           <Connector acceptCount="100"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"
                   executor="tomcatThreadPool"
                   maxKeepAliveRequests="15"
                   maxHeaderCount="30000"
                   maxHttpHeaderSize="1048576"
                   port="${connector.http.port}"
                   protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol"
                   redirectPort="${connector.https.port}"/>

To:

    # Settings migrated from web.xml
    server.server-header=PXF Server
    server.tomcat.accept-count=100
    server.tomcat.connection-timeout=20000
    server.max-http-header-size=1048576
    pxf.tomcat.max-header-count=30000
    pxf.tomcat.max-header-size=1048576

PXF Logging

Implement log4j2 logging configuration

Migrate unit tests to JUnit 5

- Make the project compile

Change REST endpoints when to switch the server to spring boot

- demo profile is fully functional
- migrated the following endpoints:

  - BridgeResource
  - FragmenterResource
  - WritableResource

Update CLI scripts when to switch the server to spring boot

CLI script changes (only change implementation and not the API)

* Remove tomcat download from Makefile
* Update starts scripts
* Update stop scripts
* Update status scripts
* Update init scripts

When we have a working pxf-service. We can start migrating the scripts to start spring boot instead of tomcat
